events.name: Houston Startup Weekend
events.about:
For all event details, visit houston.startupweekend.org

Thanks!

Startup Weekend Crew

 

Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 7 days of the event if food and drink have already been ordered. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

events.name: medX hosted by Enventure
events.about:
What?

Houstons first Med Hack Day -- a 24-hour marathon for developers, designers, scientists, educators, and the community to come together to collaboratively create ideas to change world, one step at a time.

Hack Days were originally created by Yahoo! in 2005 and soon after became a worldwide trend. By collaborating on focused tasks during a short period of time, participants are capable of producing remarkable results. Med Hack Houston specifically aims to facilitate the collaboration of individuals of all backgrounds to help make the life sciences more accessible, educational, and enjoyable at the largest medical center in the world.

Who?

Med Hack Houston calls upon medical scientists, physicians, engineers, software developers, designers, web enthusiasts, educators, and anyone else with a passion for innovating new ideas related to the medical field.

Event Schedule 

Friday evening, participants will arrive and the event to form and meet with their teams. Individuals can pitch their ideas and/or their skill sets and join teams of their interest. Team members will get the chance to get to know one another and begin brainstorms.  After a few hours of sleep, groups will reconvene Saturday morning to work on their hacks.  During the day, there will be short chalk talks, and other opportunities to learn about new medical innovations. At the end of the the day, teams will pitch their ideas, and the event will conclude with a keynote address and announcement of top hacks.

The Hacks 

Do you have a cool project in mind, and all you need is a designer and a web developer to make it happen? Or, do you have a unique skill set and drive to make something happen, but need that great idea to get started? Med Hack Houston provides a space where you can team up with eager Houstonians representing a variety of skills and backgrounds to bring your ideas to life. You will encounter unique networking opportunities and the exhilaration of sharing a room with a diverse group of passionate individuals.

Your Host:

Enventure is a networking group especially targeting and nurturing young medical entrepreneurs in Houston, TX. They meet regularly for morning coffee or happy hour and share ideas related to medical start-ups with the ultimate aim to build a home for the worlds top medical & life science innovators.
enventure.tumblr.com

events.name: Cleanweb Hackathon Texas - Houston 9/21
events.about:
Cleanweb is about applying software solutions to resource problems-- in energy, water, waste, transit, food, air, and other areas-- by taking advantage of the powerful trends in cheap computing power, mobility, data availability, and social graphs.

Join us 9/21-9/23 at Rice Universitys Duncan Hall (http://www.rice.edu/maps/maps.html) as techies, designers, subject matter experts, users, and other Cleanweb enthusiasts gather to define the most pressing Cleanweb challenges, hack together solutions, and present these killer web and mobile apps to the world by the end of the weekend.

Where will the Friday night kick-off be held?

TBD - check event website

Where is Duncan Hall?

The building occupies a prime spot on the Rice University campus. It is situated north of Lovett Hall, off the Universitys main entrance. To visit, enter Rice via entrance one. When you reach Founders Court (the lawn in front of Lovett Hall that terminates the main drive), Duncan Hall is visible to the right. You will recognize it from the gray column capitals, the blue rails and logs, and those amazing yellow balustrades.

Where should I park?

Visitor parking is available in the lots on either side of Founders Court.  The hall is also easily accessible from the Hermann Park/Rice U. stop on the METRO rail.

What should I bring?

We will provide food, water, and Internet access, as well as datasets, APIs, and sample problem statements.  Please bring your laptop, power supply, references, ideas, and anything else you might need.

Where should I stay during the weekend?

Duncan Hall will be open for the duration of the event.  There are a number of accommodation nearby.

events.name: Open Mobile App Hackathon at START
events.about:
We are pleased to announce the launch of the first mobile focused co working space - START.

Shocking yes right here in Houston!

 

 

Join us for 12 hours of adrenalin pumping redbull downing app development and be prepared to demo to win major street cred with your peers. The winner or team will receive 3 months of complimentary usage of space at START.


Come build teams or preview the space on Friday June 8th between 6pm-9pm. 

Open house for folks interested in signing up for desk space on Sunday the 10th from 12pm-6pm.

What you need to bring: Design/Development skills, laptop and mobile device of choice.


Parking: There is free parking available on the street all around the space.

events.name: Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge  - Houston, TX
events.about:
Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge

 

Headphones on. Tilt the seat back. Just steady codin’ as the keys get tapped. Get ready, because Nokia Developer is about to turn your town into Dev City with its Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge.

 

We are hitting the road to 13-cities looking for developers who want to build an experience not just another app. To kick off the Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge, Nokia Developer will hold hackathons across the US and Canada beginning in May. You can sign up individually or form your own team to build the coolest, baddest apps for the Windows Phone platform and Nokia Lumia devices.

 

Prizes will be awarded on site at each event for the top 3 created apps, top student created app, and most Nokia-branded developer (use your imagination). App winners will be judged on creativity, usability, technical difficulty and app presentation.

 

1st place:                                                $500 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

2nd place:                                               $250 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

3rd place:                                               $100 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

Student Winner:                                   $150 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

Most Nokia-Branded Dev:                  $100 gift card & Nokia Lumia 900

 

At Nokia, we don’t have ordinary developers, so these won’t be ordinary hacks. We have some amazing experiences in store – like our Re-Charge Room - for developers to chill out between pounding out code. So come showoff your skills and earn rewards. Space will be limited so register early.

The Challenge is on. . . .Ready.Set () {Code}

 

Ready.Set () {Code} Challenge Schedule:

08:30 a.m.             Light breakfast and registration

09:00 a.m.             Welcome and competition overview

09:30 a.m.             Let the hacking begin!

12:30 p.m.             Lunch

07:00 p.m.             Show us your app/Dinner

08:00 p.m.             Winners announced

 

See rules here: http://www.callingallinnovators.com/readysetchallenge/Houston
